info.title: Granular Energy data upload API
info.description:
# rate limits
In order to protect our service, a number of API endpoints are subject to rate limits and a maximum payload size. Rate limits are expressed as the maximum number of calls that can be made to an API endpoint per minute per organization.

We reserve the right to change these limits with no, or limited, notice in order to protect the service for all our customers.

servers.description: Endpoint for Granular Energy data upload API

tags.name: portfolio
tags.description: Manage demand and supply portfolio data including consumers and production devices

tags.name: metering-data
tags.description: Upload and manage ESNA generation and consumption metering data files

tags.name: contracts
tags.description: Manage ESNA LES (License Exempt Supply) contracts and memberships

tags.name: upload-calendar
tags.description: Track expected upload deadlines and submission status for settlement runs

tags.name: allocations
tags.description: Query allocation volumes for settlement dates

get.description:
Export the demand portfolio (consumers and metering points) as a CSV file. Optionally filter by specific metering point UUIDs.

### CSV Output Format
The exported CSV will contain the following columns:

| Column Name | Description |
| --- | --- |
| consumer_reference | Your unique reference for the customer |
| consumer_name | Human-readable name for the customer |
| consumer_country | Two-letter country code (e.g., `GB`) |
| metering_point_reference | Your unique reference for the metering point |
| metering_point_name | Human-readable name for the metering point |
| metering_point_grid_identifier | Official meter ID on the network |
| measurement_granularity | Measurement granularity (e.g., `PT30M`) |
| aggregation_granularity | Aggregation granularity |
| start_date | Contract start date (YYYY-MM-DD) |
| end_date | Contract end date (YYYY-MM-DD) |
| BMUnitIdentifier | Balancing Mechanism Unit identifier (for ESNA) |

**Note:** The BMUnitIdentifier column will only be present if your organization has this tag configured.

parameters.name: metering_point_uuids
parameters.description: Optional list of metering point UUIDs to filter the export. If not provided, exports all metering points.

200.description: CSV file containing demand portfolio data

post.description:
### File requirements
Using this route you can upload a CSV file containing demand portfolio data (consumers and metering points).

**Important:** All column headers listed below must be present in your CSV file header row. The "(optional)" notation means individual cell values may be empty, not that the column header itself can be omitted.

Please ensure that your file has the following columns:

| Column Name | Format | Description |
| --- | --- | --- |
| consumer_reference | string | The reference you use to identify the customer within your organisation, e.g. `CUSTOMER_001`. |
| consumer_name (optional) | string | Optional human-readable name for the customer. Defaults to the consumer_reference if not provided. |
| consumer_country | ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 | Two-letter country code, e.g. `GB`. |
| metering_point_reference | string | The reference you use to identify the metering point within your organisation. Used as a key when sending data to the Granular Energy platform, e.g. `MPAN_12345`. |
| metering_point_name (optional) | string | Optional human-readable name for the metering point. Defaults to the metering_point_reference if not provided. |
| metering_point_grid_identifier (optional) | string | The official ID of the meter on the network (e.g., MPAN for UK). |
| measurement_granularity | string | The granularity of measurements that will be uploaded for this metering point. Valid values: `PT5M`, `PT15M`, `PT30M`, `PT1H`, `P1D`, `P1M`. |
| aggregation_granularity (optional) | string | The granularity for re-aggregating data in the platform. Defaults to measurement_granularity if not provided. |
| start_date (optional) | YYYY-MM-DD | Date since when the metering point is contracted. If omitted, assumes unbounded start. |
| end_date (optional) | YYYY-MM-DD | Date until when the metering point is contracted. If omitted, assumes unbounded end. |
| BMUnitIdentifier | string | **Required for ESNA.** The Balancing Mechanism Unit identifier for the metering point. Must start with `2__` followed by a GSP Group ID (A-P), e.g. `2__A_EXAMPLE_123`. |

**Example CSV format:**
```csv
consumer_reference,consumer_name,consumer_country,metering_point_reference,metering_point_name,metering_point_grid_identifier,measurement_granularity,aggregation_granularity,start_date,end_date,BMUnitIdentifier
CUST_001,Acme Corp,GB,MPAN_001,Main Meter,1234567890123,PT30M,PT30M,2024-01-01,,2__A_ACME_001
CUST_001,Acme Corp,GB,MPAN_002,Secondary Meter,1234567890124,PT30M,PT30M,2024-01-01,2024-12-31,2__A_ACME_002
CUST_002,Beta Ltd,GB,MPAN_003,Office Meter,1234567890125,PT30M,PT30M,2024-06-01,,2__B_BETA_001
```

In this example:
- Row 1: Consumer CUST_001 with metering point MPAN_001, no end date (ongoing contract)
- Row 2: Same consumer with a second metering point that ends on 2024-12-31
- Row 3: Different consumer (CUST_002) with their own metering point

**BMUnitIdentifier format:** The BMU identifier must follow the pattern `2__X...` where `X` is a GSP Group ID (letters A through P). For example: `2__A_MYSITE_001`, `2__G_FACTORY_123`, `2__P_OFFICE_456`.

**Granularity values:** Use ISO 8601 duration format - `PT5M` (5 minutes), `PT15M` (15 minutes), `PT30M` (30 minutes), `PT1H` (1 hour), `P1D` (1 day), `P1M` (1 month).

### File processing
The uploaded file is queued for processing. Use the returned `id` to check the processing status via the GET endpoint. The data will be validated and, if successful, saved in the platform.

### Rate limit
Maximum 5 calls per minute. Subsequent calls are subject to an HTTP status code of 429 (too many requests).

parameters.name: delete_allocation_volumes
parameters.description: If true, existing allocation volumes for affected metering points will be deleted before processing the upload.

file_in.description: CSV file containing demand portfolio data

get.description:
Check the processing status of a demand portfolio file upload.

- `processingFinished: true` indicates processing is complete.
- `processingSuccessful: true` indicates the file passed validation and data was saved.
- If validation failed, errors will be listed in the `errors` field.

parameters.name: file_id
parameters.description: The file upload ID returned from the upload endpoint

get.description: Returns the expected CSV schema for demand portfolio uploads, including required columns and their formats. Use this to validate your CSV structure before uploading.

Export the supply portfolio (production devices and metering points) as a CSV file. Optionally filter by specific metering point UUIDs.

### CSV Output Format
The exported CSV will contain the following columns:

| Column Name | Description |
| --- | --- |
| production_device_reference | Your unique reference for the production device |
| production_device_name | Human-readable name for the production device |
| production_device_country | Two-letter country code (e.g., `GB`) |
| production_device_sub_national_region | Sub-national region identifier |
| technology | Generation technology type (e.g., `SOLAR`, `WIND`) |
| production_device_subsidy_regime | Support scheme (e.g., `ROC`, `FIT`, `CfD`) |
| production_device_longitude | Longitude coordinate |
| production_device_latitude | Latitude coordinate |
| production_device_commercial_operation_date | Commercial operation date (YYYY-MM-DD) |
| production_device_capacity | Capacity in kW |
| production_device_registry_identifier | Registry identifier |
| production_device_bm_unit_identifier | Balancing Mechanism Unit identifier |
| metering_point_reference | Your unique reference for the metering point |
| metering_point_name | Human-readable name for the metering point |
| metering_point_grid_identifier | Official meter ID on the network |

parameters.name: metering_point_uuids
parameters.description: Optional list of metering point UUIDs to filter the export. If not provided, exports all metering points.

200.description: CSV file containing supply portfolio data

post.description:
### File requirements
Using this route you can upload a CSV file containing supply portfolio data (production devices and metering points).

**Important:** All column headers listed below must be present in your CSV file header row. The "(optional)" notation means individual cell values may be empty, not that the column header itself can be omitted.

Please ensure that your file has the following columns:

| Column Name | Format | Description |
| --- | --- | --- |
| production_device_reference | string | The reference you use to identify the production device within your organisation, e.g. `SOLAR_FARM_001`. |
| production_device_name (optional) | string | Optional human-readable name for the production device. Defaults to the production_device_reference if not provided. |
| production_device_country | ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 | Two-letter country code, e.g. `GB`. |
| production_device_sub_national_region (optional) | string | Sub-national region identifier. |
| technology | string | Generation technology type. Valid values include: `SOLAR`, `WIND`, `HYDRO`, `BIOMASS`, `GEOTHERMAL`, `NUCLEAR`, `FOSSIL_GAS`, `FOSSIL_COAL`, `OTHER`. |
| production_device_subsidy_regime (optional) | string | State/national support scheme. Valid values: `NO_SUPPORT`, `ROC`, `FIT`, `CfD`, `OTHER`. |
| production_device_longitude (optional) | float | Longitude coordinate of the production device (-180 to 180). |
| production_device_latitude (optional) | float | Latitude coordinate of the production device (-90 to 90). |
| production_device_commercial_operation_date (optional) | YYYY-MM-DD | Date when the production device started commercial operation. |
| production_device_capacity (optional) | float | The capacity of the production device measured in kW. |
| production_device_registry_identifier (optional) | string | The identifier of the device in the registry. |
| production_device_bm_unit_identifier (optional) | string | UK Balancing Mechanism Unit identifier for the production device. Must start with `2__` followed by a GSP Group ID (A-P). |
| metering_point_reference | string | The reference you use to identify the metering point within your organisation, e.g. `METER_001`. |
| metering_point_name (optional) | string | Optional human-readable name for the metering point. Defaults to the metering_point_reference if not provided. |
| metering_point_grid_identifier (optional) | string | The official ID of the meter on the network (e.g., MPAN for UK). |

**Example CSV format:**
```csv
production_device_reference,production_device_name,production_device_country,technology,production_device_subsidy_regime,production_device_capacity,production_device_commercial_operation_date,production_device_bm_unit_identifier,metering_point_reference,metering_point_name,metering_point_grid_identifier
SOLAR_001,Solar Farm Alpha,GB,SOLAR,ROC,5000,2020-06-15,2__A_SOLAR_001,METER_001,Solar Meter 1,9876543210123
WIND_001,Wind Farm Beta,GB,WIND,CfD,10000,2019-03-01,2__G_WIND_001,METER_002,Wind Meter 1,9876543210124
SOLAR_002,Solar Rooftop Gamma,GB,SOLAR,FIT,50,2022-01-10,,METER_003,Rooftop Meter,9876543210125
```

In this example:
- Row 1: Solar production device with 5000 kW capacity, ROC subsidy, and BMU identifier
- Row 2: Wind production device with 10000 kW capacity, CfD subsidy, and BMU identifier
- Row 3: Small solar rooftop with FIT subsidy, no BMU identifier required

**BMUnitIdentifier format:** If provided, the BMU identifier must follow the pattern `2__X...` where `X` is a GSP Group ID (letters A through P). For example: `2__A_MYSITE_001`, `2__G_FACTORY_123`.

### File processing
The uploaded file is queued for processing. Use the returned `id` to check the processing status via the GET endpoint. The data will be validated and, if successful, saved in the platform.

### Rate limit
Maximum 5 calls per minute. Subsequent calls are subject to an HTTP status code of 429 (too many requests).

file.description: CSV file containing supply portfolio data

get.description:
Check the processing status of a supply portfolio file upload.

- `processingFinished: true` indicates processing is complete.
- `processingSuccessful: true` indicates the file passed validation and data was saved.
- If validation failed, errors will be listed in the `errors` field.

post.description:
### File requirements
Using this route you can upload a CSV file of ESNA generation data for one or more metering points.

**Important:** All column headers listed below must be present in your CSV file header row. The "(values optional)" notation means individual cell values may be empty, not that the column header itself can be omitted.

Please ensure that your file has the following columns:

| Column Name | Format | Description |
| --- | --- | --- |
| metering_point | string | Client reference that uniquely identifies the metering point in your organization, e.g. `solar_1`. |
| period_start | ISO 8601 datetime with UTC offset | Timestamp corresponding to the start time of the measurement step, e.g. `2022-09-30T05:00:00+02:00`. |
| unadjusted_quantity | float | The unadjusted quantity of energy (in kWh) generated through this metering point over this time step. Used when `adjusted_quantity` is not provided or is empty. |
| adjusted_quantity (values optional) | float | The adjusted quantity of energy (in kWh) generated through this metering point over this time step. **When provided and non-empty, this value takes priority over `unadjusted_quantity`.** This column header is required in the CSV, but individual cell values may be left empty. |

**Do NOT include** `settlement_date` or `settlement_run` as columns in your CSV file. These must be provided as query parameters in the API request (see parameters below).

**Example CSV format:**
```csv
metering_point,period_start,unadjusted_quantity,adjusted_quantity
SOLAR_1,2024-01-01T00:00:00+00:00,1500.5,
SOLAR_1,2024-01-01T00:30:00+00:00,1520.0,1525.0
SOLAR_1,2024-01-01T01:00:00+00:00,1480.3,
```

In this example:
- Row 1: Only `unadjusted_quantity` has a value (1500.5 kWh will be used)
- Row 2: Both quantities provided (1525.0 kWh will be used, as `adjusted_quantity` takes priority)
- Row 3: Only `unadjusted_quantity` has a value (1480.3 kWh will be used)

**Quantity prioritization:** If both `unadjusted_quantity` and `adjusted_quantity` are present in a row, the system uses `adjusted_quantity` if it has a value, otherwise it falls back to `unadjusted_quantity`. At least one of these columns must contain a value for each measurement.

Your file must be under 200MB and contain **no more than 1 million** measurements. This endpoint is specifically for ESNA (Exempt Supplier Notification Agent) related generation data uploads.
### File processing
We store your uploaded file then add it to a queue to be processed. The data will be validated and, if successful, saved in the platform. Using the `id` provided in this `POST` response, you can refer to the `GET` endpoint to check the status of this processing.

### Rate limit
The maximum number of calls per minute is 5. Subsequent calls are subject to an HTTP status code of 429 (too many requests) and exceptionally may receive a 504 status code (gateway timeout). In addition, an API request may also be rejected with this status code if there is heavy usage of the API by other clients.

In the event of being rate limited, clients should sleep for at least 60 seconds before re-trying this `POST` request.

parameters.name: settlement_date
parameters.description: Settlement date for the ESNA data upload.

parameters.name: settlement_run
parameters.description: Settlement run type for the ESNA data upload.

get.summary: Check ESNA generation file upload status
get.description:
This endpoint allows you to check the processing status of an uploaded ESNA generation file:

- File processing is complete if `isProcessingFinished` is `true`.
- If the file has failed validation, `isProcessingSuccessful` will be `false` and issues will be listed in the `errors` field.
- If the file has passed validation, `isProcessingSuccessful` will be `true` and the data will be ready to view in the platform.

parameters.name: file_id
parameters.description: Identifier for the ESNA file upload, returned from the _upload file_ `POST` endpoint.

post.description:
### File requirements
Using this route you can upload a CSV file of ESNA consumption data for one or more metering points.

**Important:** All column headers listed below must be present in your CSV file header row. The "(values optional)" notation means individual cell values may be empty, not that the column header itself can be omitted.

Please ensure that your file has the following columns:

| Column Name | format | description |
| ------------------------------------------ | ---------------------------- | - |
| metering_point | string️ | Client reference that uniquely identifies the metering point in your organization, e.g. `building_1`.|
| period_start | ISO 8601 datetime with UTC offset | Timestamp corresponding to the start time of the measurement step, e.g. `2022-09-30T05:00:00+02:00`.|
| unadjusted_quantity | float | The unadjusted quantity of energy (in kWh) consumed through this metering point over this time step. Used when `adjusted_quantity` is not provided or is empty.|
| adjusted_quantity (values optional) | float | The adjusted quantity of energy (in kWh) consumed through this metering point over this time step. **When provided and non-empty, this value takes priority over `unadjusted_quantity`.** This column header is required in the CSV, but individual cell values may be left empty.|

**Do NOT include** `settlement_date` or `settlement_run` as columns in your CSV file. These must be provided as query parameters in the API request (see parameters below).

**Example CSV format:**
```csv
metering_point,period_start,unadjusted_quantity,adjusted_quantity
BUILDING_1,2024-01-01T00:00:00+00:00,850.2,
BUILDING_1,2024-01-01T00:30:00+00:00,865.5,870.0
BUILDING_1,2024-01-01T01:00:00+00:00,845.8,
```

In this example:
- Row 1: Only `unadjusted_quantity` has a value (850.2 kWh will be used)
- Row 2: Both quantities provided (870.0 kWh will be used, as `adjusted_quantity` takes priority)
- Row 3: Only `unadjusted_quantity` has a value (845.8 kWh will be used)

**Quantity prioritization:** If both `unadjusted_quantity` and `adjusted_quantity` are present in a row, the system uses `adjusted_quantity` if it has a value, otherwise it falls back to `unadjusted_quantity`. At least one of these columns must contain a value for each measurement.

Your file must be under 200MB and contain **no more than 1 million** measurements. This endpoint is specifically for ESNA (Exempt Supplier Notification Agent) related consumption data uploads.
### File processing
We store your uploaded file then add it to a queue to be processed. The data will be validated and, if successful, saved in the platform. Using the `id` provided in this `POST` response, you can refer to the `GET` endpoint to check the status of this processing.

### Rate limit
The maximum number of calls per minute is 5. Subsequent calls are subject to an HTTP status code of 429 (too many requests) and exceptionally may receive a 504 status code (gateway timeout). In addition, an API request may also be rejected with this status code if there is heavy usage of the API by other clients.

In the event of being rate limited, clients should sleep for at least 60 seconds before re-trying this `POST` request.

parameters.name: settlement_date
parameters.description: Settlement date for the ESNA data upload.

parameters.name: settlement_run
parameters.description: Settlement run type for the ESNA data upload.

get.summary: Check ESNA consumption file upload status
get.description:
This endpoint allows you to check the processing status of an uploaded ESNA consumption file:

- File processing is complete if `isProcessingFinished` is `true`.
- If the file has failed validation, `isProcessingSuccessful` will be `false` and issues will be listed in the `errors` field.
- If the file has passed validation, `isProcessingSuccessful` will be `true` and the data will be ready to view in the platform.

parameters.name: file_id
parameters.description: Identifier for the ESNA file upload, returned from the _upload file_ `POST` endpoint.

get.description: List all ESNA LES (License Exempt Supply) contracts in your organization.

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: Filter by contract status

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Maximum number of contracts to return

parameters.name: skip
parameters.description: Number of contracts to skip for pagination

post.description: Create a new ESNA LES (License Exempt Supply) contract.

get.description: Get ESNA LES contract MPANs (Metering Point Administration Numbers) filtered by date range. This endpoint returns a flat list of metering points with denormalized contract and membership information, useful for querying which metering points are active in contracts during a specific time period.

parameters.name: start_date
parameters.description: Optional start date filter (YYYY-MM-DD format). Filters contract memberships based on their start and end date.

parameters.name: end_date
parameters.description: Optional end date filter (YYYY-MM-DD format). Filters contracts based on their date range.

get.description: Get a specific ESNA LES contract by ID.

parameters.name: contract_id
parameters.description: Unique identifier for the ESNA contract

put.description: Update an existing ESNA LES contract.

parameters.name: contract_id
parameters.description: Unique identifier for the ESNA contract

parameters.name: contract_id
parameters.description: Unique identifier for the ESNA contract

get.description: Download the PDF file associated with a specific ESNA LES contract. The PDF file must have been previously uploaded via the upload endpoint.

parameters.name: contract_id
parameters.description: Unique identifier for the ESNA contract

404.description: Contract not found or contract has no file uploaded

post.description: Upload a PDF file for a specific ESNA LES contract. The file must be in PDF format and cannot exceed 10 MB in size. This will associate the uploaded PDF with the contract record.

parameters.name: contract_id
parameters.description: Unique identifier for the ESNA contract

413.description: File size exceeds maximum allowed size of 10 MB

post.description: Add a metering point membership to an ESNA LES contract.

parameters.name: contract_id
parameters.description: Unique identifier for the ESNA contract

patch.description: Update an existing ESNA LES contract membership. Only the start_date and end_date can be modified. To change which asset or counterparty the membership refers to, you must delete and recreate the membership.

parameters.name: contract_id
parameters.description: Unique identifier for the ESNA contract

parameters.name: membership_id
parameters.description: Unique identifier for the membership

delete.description: Delete an ESNA LES contract membership.

parameters.name: contract_id
parameters.description: Unique identifier for the ESNA contract

parameters.name: membership_id
parameters.description: Unique identifier for the membership

get.description:
Returns ESNA expected upload calendar entries with upload deadlines and status information. The calendar tracks when generation and consumption data files should be uploaded for each settlement date and run.

Results are ordered by settlement_date descending, settlement_run descending.

parameters.name: start_date
parameters.description: Optional start date filter (YYYY-MM-DD format). Only entries with settlement_date on or after this date will be returned.

parameters.name: end_date
parameters.description: Optional end date filter (YYYY-MM-DD format). Only entries with settlement_date on or before this date will be returned.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Maximum number of results to return (between 1 and 1000)

parameters.name: skip
parameters.description: Number of results to skip for pagination

get.summary: Get specific ESNA expected upload calendar entry
get.description: Returns a specific ESNA expected upload calendar entry by ID with complete status transition history. Use this endpoint to track the detailed progress of a particular settlement date and run through the upload and validation workflow.

parameters.name: upload_id
parameters.description: UUID of the expected upload calendar entry

404.description: Expected upload calendar entry not found

get.description: Get unadjusted allocation volumes for a specific settlement date and allocation run. Returns detailed allocation information with pagination support.

parameters.name: settlement_date
parameters.description: Settlement date for which to retrieve allocations (YYYY-MM-DD format)

parameters.name: allocation_run_id
parameters.description: UUID of the allocation run

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Maximum number of results to return (between 1 and 1000)

parameters.name: skip
parameters.description: Number of results to skip for pagination

id.description: Unique identifier for the uploaded file. Use this to query the `GET` endpoint for info on file processing status.

errorCode.description:
Type of error, split into file errors (causing validation to fail early) and data errors.

**File structure errors:**
- `EMPTY_FILE`: File contains nothing at all.
- `UNPARSEABLE_FILE`: File cannot be parsed as comma-separated values with UTF-8 encoding.
- `TOO_MANY_COLUMNS`: More columns are present in the header row than required.
- `MISSING_COLUMN_HEADERS`: Fewer columns are present in the header row than required.
- `UNRECOGNISED_COLUMN_HEADERS`: Column names in the header row cannot be matched to the required columns.
- `DUPLICATE_COLUMN_HEADERS`: Multiple column names or aliases in the header row resolve to the same required column.
- `NOT_ENOUGH_DATA`: File contains less than the minimum number of required measurements.
- `PAYLOAD_TOO_LARGE`: File includes over 1 million measurements.
- `MISSING_COLUMN`: Required column missing from CSV.
- `NON_UTF8_DATA`: File encoding is not UTF-8.

**Metering data errors:**
- `INVALID_STEP`: Invalid time difference, or different metering points, across the first two rows of data. We currently support time steps of 5/15/30/60 minutes, 1 day or 1 month.
- `DUPLICATE_MEASUREMENT`: There is more than one measurement in the file with this metering point and timestamp.
- `OVERLAPPING_AGGREGATE_MEASUREMENT`: Measurement overlaps with existing data from the same consumer or device.
- `MEASUREMENT_CONFLICTS_WITH_EXISTING_ALLOCATIONS`: Incoming generation measurement would cause a reduction in allocated supply.
- `NO_VALID_METERING_POINT_STATE_FOUND`: Metering point could not be matched to a consumer at the given timestamp.
- `AMBIGUOUS_METERING_POINT_STATES`: Metering point could be matched to several possible consumers but should only refer to one.

**Field validation errors:**
- `MISSING_REQUIRED_VALUE`: No value has been provided in a column where values are required.
- `UNKNOWN_REFERENCE`: No match has been found for this value in our database.
- `NOT_A_NUMBER`: A number was expected but the value could not be coerced into one.
- `NEGATIVE_QUANTITY`: Quantities should always be greater than or equal to zero.
- `NUMBER_TOO_LARGE`: Number exceeds the maximum value that we can represent internally.
- `UNPARSEABLE_DATETIME`: Timestamp does not conform to the ISO 8601 format.
- `UNZONED_DATETIME`: Timestamp is ambiguous; an explicit UTC offset should be provided.
- `UNSUPPORTED_DATETIME`: Timestamp should align with the specified or inferred measurement duration.
- `UNPARSEABLE_DATE`: Date string cannot be parsed.
- `DATE_OUT_OF_RANGE`: Date outside valid range (2000-2100).
- `INVALID_GRANULARITY`: Measurement granularity is invalid.
- `INVALID_AGGREGATION_GRANULARITY`: Aggregation granularity is invalid.

**Demand portfolio errors:**
- `DUPLICATE_CONFLICTING_CONSUMER`: Consumer defined differently in another row.
- `INVALID_COUNTRY`: Country code is invalid.
- `INVALID_BMU_IDENTIFIER`: BMU identifier format is invalid (must start with '2__' followed by GSP Group ID A-P).
- `EXISTING_CONFLICTING_METERING_POINT`: Conflicts with existing metering point.
- `OVERLAPPING_METERING_POINT_STATE`: Time periods overlap for same metering point.
- `INVALID_TIME_PERIOD`: Start date is after end date.
- `ALLOCATIONS_EXIST_FOR_CHANGED_PERIOD`: Cannot modify period with existing allocations.

**Supply portfolio errors:**
- `DUPLICATE_CONFLICTING_ASSET`: Asset defined differently in another row.
- `INVALID_COORDINATES`: Coordinates cannot be parsed.
- `INVALID_LATITUDE`: Latitude outside valid range (-90 to 90).
- `INVALID_LONGITUDE`: Longitude outside valid range (-180 to 180).
- `INVALID_TECHNOLOGY`: Generation technology type is invalid.
- `INVALID_SUBSIDY_REGIME`: Subsidy regime is invalid.
- `INVALID_CAPACITY`: Capacity value invalid or negative.
- `INVALID_COMMERCIAL_OPERATION_DATE`: Commercial operation date cannot be parsed.
- `REGISTRY_IDENTIFIER_CONFLICT`: Registry ID conflicts with another asset.

**Other errors:**
- `INTERNAL_ERROR`: Something went wrong on our end. Please contact support if the problem persists.

lineNumber.description: Line where the error was found in the file. Line 1 is the header row and Line 2 is the first data row.

columnNumber.description: Column where the error was found in the file. This is the (1-indexed) CSV column number, not a character number.

errorMessage.description: Information about how to resolve the issue.

FileUploadError.description: Details of a file validation error.

totalEnergyQuantity.description: Total energy quantity (in kWh) across all metering points in the file.

countMeteringPoint.description: Number of unique metering points in the file.

orphanedMeasurements.description: Description of any orphaned measurements in the upload (measurements for metering points without known state).

exampleMeteringPoints.description: Inexhaustive list of metering points with orphaned measurements.

ConsumptionFileUploadReport.description: Summary of the uploaded data, shown only if the file has passed validation.

GenerationFileUploadReport.description: Summary of the uploaded data, shown only if the file has passed validation.

id.description: Unique identifier for the uploaded file, returned in the `POST` response.

status.description:
Current status of the file upload:
- `UPLOADED`: File has been received by Granular.
- `STORED`: File has been stored ready for processing.
- `QUEUED`: File is in the queue awaiting processing.
- `PROCESSING`: File data is undergoing validation.
- `NOT_COMPLIANT`: File has failed validation and data has not been saved in the platform. Issues will be detailed in the `errors` field.
- `SUCCESSFUL`: File has passed validation and data has been saved in the platform.
- `FAILED`: Something else went wrong during file processing. Please try again later or contact support if the problem persists.

This list may change in future so please use the `processingFinished` and `processingSuccessful` flags in your application control flow.

processingFinished.description: Indicates if file processing is complete, whether failed or successful.

processingSuccessful.description: Indicates whether file processing finished successfully. Data will be visible in the platform if true.

errors.description: List of file validation errors, if any. Only the first 50 will be shown.

id.description: Unique Granular identifier for the metering point

deviceName.description: Name of the device associated with the metering point

clientReference.description: Your unique client reference for the metering point

id.description: Unique Granular identifier for the metering point

consumerName.description: Name of the consumer associated with the metering point

clientReference.description: Your unique client reference for the metering point

contracts.description: List of ESNA LES contracts for the current page

id.description: Unique identifier for the ESNA contract

contract_file_id.description: ID of the associated contract file

contract_filename.description: Filename of the uploaded contract PDF, if any

memberships.description: List of metering point memberships associated with this contract

contract_file_id.description: ID of the associated contract file
ID of the associated contract file

asset_id.description: ID of the asset (production/generation entity). Either asset_id OR counterparty_id will be set, never both. When set, this membership represents production capacity participating in the LES contract.

counterparty_id.description: ID of the counterparty (consumption/demand entity). Either asset_id OR counterparty_id will be set, never both. When set, this membership represents demand/consumption participating in the LES contract.

asset_name.description: Name of the asset, if asset_id is set

counterparty_name.description: Name of the counterparty, if counterparty_id is set

member_type.description: Type of member in the contract: 'asset' for production/generation entities, 'counterparty' for consumption/demand entities

asset_id.description: ID of the asset to add to the contract. Exactly one of asset_id or counterparty_id must be provided.

counterparty_id.description: ID of the counterparty to add to the contract. Exactly one of asset_id or counterparty_id must be provided.

metering_point_reference.description: Client reference for the metering point

membership_start_date.description: Date when the metering point membership in the contract started

membership_end_date.description: Date when the metering point membership in the contract ended

asset_reference.description: Client reference for the asset, if this is an asset membership

asset_name.description: Name of the asset, if this is an asset membership

counterparty_reference.description: Client reference for the counterparty, if this is a counterparty membership

counterparty_name.description: Name of the counterparty, if this is a counterparty membership

mpans.description: Flat list of metering points with denormalized contract and membership information. Each entry represents a metering point associated with a contract membership, with all relevant contract and member details included.

id.description: Unique identifier for the status history entry

status.description: Status of the expected upload at this point in history

reason.description: Optional reason for the status change

created_at.description: Timestamp when this status was recorded

id.description: Unique identifier for the expected upload calendar entry

settlement_date.description: Settlement date for which data is expected

settlement_run.description: Settlement run type (II: Interim Initial +5 working days, SF: Settlement Final +17 working days, R1: First Reconciliation +35 working days, R2: Second Reconciliation +80 working days)

elexon_processing_date.description: Date when Elexon processes this settlement data

granular_submission_due_at.description: Deadline for Granular to submit data to SAA

supplier_submission_date_at.description: Deadline for supplier to submit data to Granular

generation_file_id.description: ID of the uploaded generation file, if any

consumption_file_id.description: ID of the uploaded consumption file, if any

saa_allocation_file_id.description: ID of the generated SAA allocation file, if any

saa_encrypted_file_id.description: ID of the encrypted SAA file, if any

latest_status.description: Current status of the expected upload

latest_status_at.description: Timestamp of the latest status change

created_at.description: Timestamp when the calendar entry was created

modified_at.description: Timestamp when the calendar entry was last modified

status_history.description: Complete history of status transitions for this entry

calendar_entries.description: List of expected upload calendar entries for the current page. Entries are ordered by settlement_date descending, settlement_run descending.

total_count.description: Total number of calendar entries available matching the filters

adjusted_allocation_volume_id.description: Unique identifier for the adjusted allocation volume

unadjusted_quantity.description: The unadjusted quantity of energy (in kWh)

modified_at.description: Timestamp when the unadjusted allocation was last modified

allocation_volume_id.description: Unique identifier for the allocation volume

adjusted_quantity.description: The adjusted quantity of energy (in kWh)

asset_id.description: ID of the asset, if applicable

allocations.description: List of unadjusted allocations for the current page

total_count.description: Total number of allocations available matching the filters

createdConsumerCount.description: Number of consumers created from the upload

createdMeteringPointCount.description: Number of metering points created from the upload

orphanedMeasurements.description: Details of any orphaned measurements (measurements for metering points without known state)

uploadedAt.description: Timestamp when the file was uploaded

processingSuccessful.description: Whether processing completed successfully. Null if processing is not finished.

productionDevicesUpdatedCount.description: Number of existing production devices updated

meteringPointsCreatedCount.description: Number of new metering points created

CSVSchema.description: Schema definition for CSV file uploads, describing expected columns and their formats

type.description: Expected data type (e.g., string, integer, date)

Generic401.description: You are not authenticated. Contact support to request an API key.

Generic403.description: You are not authorized to access this resource as your API key does not have the required scopes. Contact support for more info.

Generic429.description: You have exceeded the rate limit for this endpoint. Please wait one minute before retrying.

bearer-token.description: A bearer token must be passed via the Authorization header. Please request one from support.
bearer-token.name: Authorization
